mainEntity.name: Are crash casinos legal in the UK?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, if they hold a UKGC license. It's illegal for unlicensed casinos to accept UK players.

mainEntity.name: Can UK players play at Stake or BC.Game?

acceptedAnswer.text: No. Most crypto casinos (Stake, BC.Game, etc.) do not accept UK players because they don't have UKGC licenses. Attempting to play from the UK with a VPN may result in frozen funds.

mainEntity.name: What's the minimum age for crash gambling in the UK?

acceptedAnswer.text: 18+. All UKGC casinos verify your age before you can deposit.

mainEntity.name: Do UK crash casinos offer crypto?

acceptedAnswer.text: Rarely. Most UKGC casinos accept GBP (Faster Payments, debit cards) but not crypto. A few accept Bitcoin, but it's uncommon.
GamStop is the UK's national self-exclusion scheme. Registering excludes you from all UKGC-licensed casinos for 6 months to 5 years.

mainEntity.name: How fast are withdrawals at UK crash casinos?

acceptedAnswer.text: 1-24 hours for Faster Payments. Some casinos process within hours, others take up to 24h.

mainEntity.name: Do UK crash casinos have provably fair games?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes. UKGC requires all games to be tested and certified by independent labs (e.g., eCOGRA, iTech Labs). Crash games use RNG systems that are audited regularly.
